SEARCH

Class Server_java_UDP

java.lang.Object
Server_java_UDP
public class Server_java_UDP extends Object
A simple UDP server that receives a message and a keyword from a client Anonymizes the message and sends it back to the client, with the number of "Socket Programming"'s equal to the number of substitutions made in the message. If the String sent is larger than the buffer size, it will be divided into parts and sent separately, and the server will reassemble it. This system uses an 'ACK' message to ensure the data is sent completely. (order not guaranteed) It only communicates with one client at a time.

    • sendData

      public void sendData(int numberOfSocketProgrammings, String[] dividedAnonymizedMessage)
      Sends the anonymized message back to the client, in this order: 1. the number of socket programmings, 2. the number of parts of the message, 3. the parts of the message
      Parameters:
      numberOfSocketProgrammings - The number of "Socket Programming"'s in the message
      dividedAnonymizedMessage - The parts of the anonymized message to be sent back to the client (in an array of Strings)
